In one treatise, O. Ikola (1949-50) investigated the use of tenses in Old Literary Finnish, compared with Modern Finnish usage. In another treatise (1960) he dealt with reported speech in Finnish synchronically as well as diachronically. A paper by Ikola opened a long discussion on the cases of the subject and on the congruence of subject and predicate in Finnish (Ikola 1954-57
